title: Test
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Per capita consumption in pounds, with a total of 19 data points.
Overall Per capita consumption in pounds has increased over the Year.

Per capita consumption in pounds is roughly constant from 2000 to 2001, slightly increasing from 2001 to 2002, roughly constant from 2002 to 2004, roughly increasing from 2004 to 2006, roughly constant from 2006 to 2009, gradually increasing from 2009 to 2011, roughly constant from 2011 to 2012, slightly increasing from 2012 to 2013, slightly decreasing from 2013 to 2014, roughly constant from 2014 to 2015, gradually increasing from 2015 to 2017, and lastly roughly constant from 2017 to 2018.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2012 and 2013.
Max Per capita consumption in pounds about 3.22 was recorded at Year 2017
Min Per capita consumption in pounds about 1.75 was recorded at Year 2000
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Per capita consumption in pounds, with a total of 19 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2014 to 2018.
Likewise, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2009 to 2012.
Additionally, the next significant trend is slightly constant which exists from 2006 to 2009.
Conversely, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2003 to 2006.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2000 to 2003.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly increasing which exists from 2012 to 2014.
